summary: This document is a profile page for the organization ChildUSA, highlighting its mission and leadership. It focuses on James R. Marsh, Esq., the Chairman of the Board, detailing his extensive legal career advocating for children and victims of sexual abuse and exploitation, including his work on landmark legislation.

persons.name: James R. Marsh
persons.role: Chairman of the Board of ChildUSA, Founder of Marsh Law Firm
persons.context: Described as having over 30 years of experience advocating for children, victims, and survivors, instrumental in passing major laws on behalf of victims of childhood sexual abuse, and founder of the Children's Law Center and the Marsh Law Firm.

persons.name: Amy
persons.context: Name appears in the title of the 'Amy, Vicky, and Andy Child Pornography Victim Assistance Act of 2018', a law mentioned as resulting from legal work connected to James Marsh.

events.title: Supreme Court Decision in United States v. Paroline
events.description: A case on compensation for victims of child pornography in federal criminal restitution proceedings was decided by the United States Supreme Court. James Marsh was instrumental in this case.

events.title: Enactment of Amy, Vicky, and Andy Child Pornography Victim Assistance Act
events.description: Legislation passed the House and Senate by unanimous consent and was signed into law. This act is directly linked to the legal work and advocacy of James Marsh.

keyFacts: James R. Marsh, Chairman of ChildUSA, has over 30 years of legal experience advocating for children and victims of sexual abuse.
The organization he founded, the Children's Law Center in Washington, DC, has provided over $125 million in free legal advocacy to over 50,000 at-risk children.
Marsh was instrumental in the Supreme Court case United States v. Paroline (2014), which dealt with restitution for child pornography victims.
The legal work connected to Marsh led to the passage of the Amy, Vicky, and Andy Child Pornography Victim Assistance Act of 2018.
He founded the Marsh Law Firm in New York, which is recognized worldwide for helping victims of sexual abuse obtain justice.
